page.title: 17Living in Dargate.
page.content: I have a good neighbour 200 yards away we have just met and exchanged 6 months news. She has rushed home to her sheep, I to my teaching. The evening WI started l0 years ago for folk like us, I felt I knew every- one in the village then. Now, so many older residents have gone and those who replace them- at great expense, houses are so dear- increasingly use the village as a dormitory and do not take part in village life. As a previously town dwelling incomer this makes me sad. Be positive- we still have our post office and shop. I can still look up the hills across the orchards to the woods. The lovely colour changes tell me the seasons whatever the weather. I can still find primroses, bluebells and blackberries in season, and there is still the /very/ occasional red bus
